CatDescriptText: Pearline Green was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Out column published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 4, 1975, pg. 4. "...This week Pittsburghers Speak asked football enthusiasts what they thought of the "74" Steelers and their quest for the "big bowl." Answer reads: "So far the Steelers have done a commendable job.  The task which confronts us of the most significance is the Oakland Raider team.  I can't help believing that they will come up with the lucky play.  Did you watch the Oakland-Miami game?  Well you know what I mean then.  I'm not that much of a football fan, but I feel that the Steelers will have to work closely together to beat them."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Pearline Green wearing afro and crochet vest, standing with arms crossed on top of car door
